com.mta.tehreer.opentype

Class OpenTypeAlbum

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.opentype.OpenTypeAlbum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class OpenTypeAlbum
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    An OpenTypeAlbum object is a container for the results of text shaping. It is filled by OpenTypeArtist to provide the information related to characters, their glyphs, offsets, and advances. It can be safely accessed from multiple threads but only one thread should be allowed to manipulate it at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • finalizable

        public static OpenTypeAlbum finalizable(OpenTypeAlbum openTypeAlbum)
        Wraps an open type album object into a finalizable instance which is guaranteed to be disposed automatically by the GC when no longer in use. After calling this method, dispose() should not be called on either original object or returned object. Calling dispose() on returned object will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Note: The behaviour is undefined if an already disposed object is passed-in as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        openTypeAlbum - The open type album object to wrap into a finalizable instance.
        Returns:
        The finalizable instance of the passed-in open type album object.

      • isFinalizable

        public static boolean isFinalizable(OpenTypeAlbum openTypeAlbum)
        Checks whether an open type album object is finalizable or not.
        Parameters:
        openTypeAlbum - The open type album object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the passed-in open type album object is finalizable, false otherwise.

        Throws:

      • copyGlyphInfos

        public void copyGlyphInfos(int fromIndex,
                           int toIndex,
                           float scaleFactor,
                           int[] glyphIDs,
                           float[] xOffsets,
                           float[] yOffsets,
                           float[] advances)
        Copies glyph infos in specified range to passed-in arrays.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - The index of the first element (inclusive) to be copied.
        toIndex - The index of the last element (exclusive) to be copied.
        scaleFactor - The scale factor to apply on glyph offsets and advances before copying.
        glyphIDs - The array that receives the glyph ids in specified range.
        xOffsets - The array that receives the scaled x- offsets in specified range.
        yOffsets - The array that receives the scaled y- offsets in specified range.
        advances - The array that receives the scaled advances in specified range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following is true:
        • fromIndex is negative
        • toIndex is greater than getGlyphCount()
        • fromIndex is greater than toIndex
        • Any of the non-null passed-in array does not have the capacity to hold toIndex - fromIndex elements

      • copyCharGlyphIndexes

        public void copyCharGlyphIndexes(int fromIndex,
                                 int toIndex,
                                 int[] charGlyphIndexes)
        Copies glyph indexes of characters in specified range to passed-in array.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - The index of the first character (inclusive) in source text.
        toIndex - The index of the last character (exclusive) in source text.
        charGlyphIndexes - The array that receives the glyph indexes in specified range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following is true:
        • fromIndex is less than getCharStart()
        • toIndex is greater than getCharEnd()
        • fromIndex is greater than toIndex
        • charGlyphIndexes array does not have the capacity to hold toIndex - fromIndex elements

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases the native memory of this object. Failing to call this method will cause memory leaks.

        Note: The behaviour of this method is undefined if called more than once on the same object.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
